taskbody.context: Use this procedure, to run the Repair KeyGenerator tool. Only run this tool after the data base has been restored and is healthy. The "TPA_repairKeyGenerator" tool is used to repair the "KeyGenerators" data set during the disaster recovery process. The "KeyGenerators" data set is a set defined in the "dsclocal" namespace that stores the highest sequence generated against the set name. NCC uses the sequence stored in the "KeyGenerators" data set to generate unique club ids. The NCC increments the sequence in multiples of 10, rather than incrementing by 1 every time.

step.cmd: Log in to the OAME node as the tpaadmin user.
Navigate to “/opt/tpa/bin/” directory where the tool is located.
Enter the following command to launch the Repair KeyGenerator tool. See for more information.

info.p: The tool does not have options and asks for a confirmation before proceeding with the recovery task. Choose “y”.
